definition[0]: to speak in a low voice, especially because you are annoyed about something, or you do not want people to hear you
example[0]: Elsie muttered something I couldn’t catch and walked off.
example[1]: ‘He’s such an unpleasant man, ’ Alyssia muttered under her breath.
example[2]: ‘I never want to come here again, ’ he muttered to himself.
example[3]: What are you two muttering about?
definition[1]: to complain about something or express doubts about it, but without saying clearly and openly what you think
example[4]: Some senators muttered darkly about the threat to national security.
